page.title: 02LANDSCAPE.
page.content: The first piece of land looked at was Oakfield Farm.It consisted of several large fields which were divided up by a small winding lane.The rest of this area was mainly the same, isolated farms surrounded by fields.These farms were called Clattercut Farm and Lowbridge Farm. Rushock Village was in this area yet it was not a village in the proper sense of the word,it was only ten houses and a church.It was so small we didn't realise we were going through it until we reached the church. Over the whole area 60% of the ground was taken up by grassland,27% grazing land,6% residential area.Then there was land reserved for Horse jumping and orchards which took up 4% and 3% respectively. { Robert Price { & Dipple.
